content.body: Is it possible to add a Symbol.unthenable and attach it to the module namespace object?

> <@jackworks:matrix.org> Is it possible to add a Symbol.unthenable and attach it to the module namespace object?

technically yes, but that exact proposal was basically rejected in 2018 https://github.com/devsnek/proposal-symbol-thenable
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @jackworks:matrix.org
Is it possible to add a Symbol.unthenable and attach it to the module namespace object?
technically yes, but that exact proposal was basically rejected in 2018 https://github.com/devsnek/proposal-symbol-thenable

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body:
> <@jackworks:matrix.org> Is it possible to add a Symbol.unthenable and attach it to the module namespace object?

technically yes, but that exact proposal was basically rejected in 2018 https://github.com/devsnek/proposal-symbol-thenable

In reply to @jackworks:matrix.org
Is it possible to add a Symbol.unthenable and attach it to the module namespace object?
technically yes, but that exact proposal was basically rejected in 2018 https://github.com/devsnek/proposal-symbol-thenable

content.body: It sounds like this is the opposite direction. Instead of proactively marking as thenable, you assume thenable and mark as unthenable
content.formatted_body: It sounds like this is the opposite direction. Instead of proactively marking as thenable, you assume thenable and mark as unthenable
